bug.summary: Lightning cant find visible gpu when using pytorch 1.5.0
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When using the latest pytorch version 1.5.0 with multi-gpu's (backend ddp), lightning says there are no visible gpu's. The same code runs without issues when using pytorch 1.4.0 <denchmark-code> File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 464, in __init__ self.data_parallel_device_ids = parse_gpu_ids(self.gpus) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_parts.py", line 730, in parse_gpu_ids gpus = sanitize_gpu_ids(gpus) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_parts.py", line 696, in sanitize_gpu_ids """) pytorch_lightning.utilities.exceptions.MisconfigurationException: You requested GPUs: [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] But your machine only has: [] </denchmark-code>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.5.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip Python version: 3.7 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1 GPU models and configuration: Nvidia - V100 - 8 gpu's Lightning - 0.7.6

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!
mind posting a script to recreate?
also make sure you have the gpu version of pytorch

i'm kind of sensing that you stopped your aws instance and resumed it. I encountered this exact same "bug" when I did that. For some unknown reasons, when you stop a gpu instance on aws and resume it, the nvidia driver goes away.. Try nvidia-smi to see if you still see your GPUs.
I was using cuda 10.1 and upgraded pytorch (which by default expects cuda 10.2). Installed pytorch 1.5.0 in the right way and it fixed the issue
